trans-unit.source: Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using Portal
trans-unit.target: Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using Portal

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure an authorization policy for a content key.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure an authorization policy for a content key.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver your content encrypted with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys) and PlayReady DRM.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services enables you to deliver your content encrypted with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys) and PlayReady DRM.

trans-unit.source: Media Services also provides a Key\License Delivery Service from which clients can obtain a key or license to play the encrypted content.
trans-unit.target: Media Services also provides a Key\License Delivery Service from which clients can obtain a key or license to play the encrypted content.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use the Azure Management Portal to configure the content key authorization policy.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use the Azure Management Portal to configure the content key authorization policy.

trans-unit.source: The key can later be used to dynamically encrypt your content.
trans-unit.target: The key can later be used to dynamically encrypt your content.

trans-unit.source: Note that currently you can encrypt the following streaming formats: HLS, MPEG DASH, and Smooth Streaming.
trans-unit.target: Note that currently you can encrypt the following streaming formats: HLS, MPEG DASH, and Smooth Streaming.

trans-unit.source: You cannot encrypt HDS streaming format, or progressive downloads.
trans-unit.target: You cannot encrypt HDS streaming format, or progressive downloads.

trans-unit.source: When a player requests a stream that is set to be dynamically encrypted, Media Services uses the configured key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES or PlayReady encryption.
trans-unit.target: When a player requests a stream that is set to be dynamically encrypted, Media Services uses the configured key to dynamically encrypt your content using AES or PlayReady encryption.

trans-unit.source: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: To decrypt the stream, the player will request the key from the key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.
trans-unit.target: To decide whether or not the user is authorized to get the key, the service evaluates the authorization policies that you specified for the key.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to have multiple content keys or want to specify a Key\License Delivery Service URL other than the Media Services key delivery service, use Media Services .NET SDK or REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to have multiple content keys or want to specify a Key\License Delivery Service URL other than the Media Services key delivery service, use Media Services .NET SDK or REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using Media Services .NET SDK</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using Media Services .NET SDK</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using Media Services REST API</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Content Key Authorization Policy using Media Services REST API</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: To be able to use dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption, you must make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption, you must make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale a Media Service](media-services-manage-origins.md#scalestreamingendpoints).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale a Media Service](media-services-manage-origins.md#scalestreamingendpoints).

trans-unit.source: Your asset must contain a set of adaptive bitrate MP4s or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files.
trans-unit.target: Your asset must contain a set of adaptive bitrate MP4s or adaptive bitrate Smooth Streaming files.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Encode an asset</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Encode an asset</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Key Delivery service caches ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and its related objects (policy options and restrictions) for 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The Key Delivery service caches ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and its related objects (policy options and restrictions) for 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you create a ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and specify to use a “Token” restriction, then test it, and then update the policy to “Open” restriction, it will take roughly 15 minutes before the policy switches to the “Open” version of the policy.
trans-unit.target: If you create a ContentKeyAuthorizationPolicy and specify to use a “Token” restriction, then test it, and then update the policy to “Open” restriction, it will take roughly 15 minutes before the policy switches to the “Open” version of the policy.

trans-unit.source: To configure the key authorization policy, select the CONTENT PROTECTION page.
trans-unit.target: To configure the key authorization policy, select the CONTENT PROTECTION page.

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports multiple ways of authenticating users who make key requests.

trans-unit.source: The content key authorization policy can have open, token, or IP authorization restrictions (IP can be configured with REST or .NET SDK).
trans-unit.target: The content key authorization policy can have open, token, or IP authorization restrictions (IP can be configured with REST or .NET SDK).

trans-unit.source: The open restriction means the system will deliver the key to anyone who makes a key request.
trans-unit.target: The open restriction means the system will deliver the key to anyone who makes a key request.

trans-unit.source: This restriction might be useful for testing purposes.
trans-unit.target: This restriction might be useful for testing purposes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>OpenPolicy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>OpenPolicy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To choose the token restricted policy, press the TOKEN button.
trans-unit.target: To choose the token restricted policy, press the TOKEN button.

trans-unit.source: The token restricted policy must be accompanied by a token issued by a Secure Token Service (STS).
trans-unit.target: The token restricted policy must be accompanied by a token issued by a Secure Token Service (STS).

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports tokens in the Simple Web Tokens (SWT) format and JSON Web Token (JWT) format.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports tokens in the Simple Web Tokens (SWT) format and JSON Web Token (JWT) format.

trans-unit.source: For information, see <linkText>JWT token authentication</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information, see <linkText>JWT token authentication</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Media Services does not provide Secure Token Services.
trans-unit.target: Media Services does not provide Secure Token Services.

trans-unit.source: You can create a custom STS or leverage Microsoft Azure ACS to issue tokens.
trans-unit.target: You can create a custom STS or leverage Microsoft Azure ACS to issue tokens.

trans-unit.source: The STS must be configured to create a token signed with the specified key and issue claims that you specified in the token restriction configuration.
trans-unit.target: The STS must be configured to create a token signed with the specified key and issue claims that you specified in the token restriction configuration.

trans-unit.source: The Media Services key delivery service will return the encryption key to the client if the token is valid and the claims in the token match those configured for the content key.
trans-unit.target: The Media Services key delivery service will return the encryption key to the client if the token is valid and the claims in the token match those configured for the content key.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Use Azure ACS to issue tokens</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Use Azure ACS to issue tokens</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When configuring the TOKEN restricted policy, you must set values for verification key, issuer and audience.
trans-unit.target: When configuring the TOKEN restricted policy, you must set values for verification key, issuer and audience.

trans-unit.source: The primary verification key contains the key that the token was signed with, issuer is the secure token service that issues the token.
trans-unit.target: The primary verification key contains the key that the token was signed with, issuer is the secure token service that issues the token.

trans-unit.source: The audience (sometimes called scope) describes the intent of the token or the resource the token authorizes access to.
trans-unit.target: The audience (sometimes called scope) describes the intent of the token or the resource the token authorizes access to.

trans-unit.source: The Media Services key delivery service validates that these values in the token match the values in the template.
trans-unit.target: The Media Services key delivery service validates that these values in the token match the values in the template.

trans-unit.source: When protecting your content with PlayReady, one of the things you need to specify in your authorization policy is an XML string that defines the PlayReady license template.
trans-unit.target: When protecting your content with PlayReady, one of the things you need to specify in your authorization policy is an XML string that defines the PlayReady license template.

trans-unit.source: By default, the following policy is set:
trans-unit.target: By default, the following policy is set:

trans-unit.source: You can click the import policy xml button and provide a different XML which conforms to the XML Schema defined here.
trans-unit.target: You can click the import policy xml button and provide a different XML which conforms to the XML Schema defined here.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have configured content key's authorization policy, go to the <linkText>How to: Use the Azure Management Portal to enable encryption</linkText><title></title> topic.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have configured content key's authorization policy, go to the <linkText>How to: Use the Azure Management Portal to enable encryption</linkText><title></title> topic.
